newsitem.title: USA: K-tel FY97 EPS could reach $1.14 - CFO.
newsitem.headline: K-tel FY97 EPS could reach $1.14 - CFO.

text.p: K-tel International Inc chief financial officer Mark Dixon said Tuesday the company continues in a turnaround mode and could earn $1.14 per share in fiscal 1997 ending June 30.

"Without forecasting, it ($1.14 earnings per share) is realistic. In the first half, we made $0.46 (earnings per share) without the $0.22 (settlement). And it's not completely out of line to say that our second half could do that," Dixon told Reuters following the annual shareholders meeting.

In the second quarter, the music and video marketer reported that it had settled a legal dispute with Tring Ltd, a British entertainment company, regarding infringements of K-tel's music master recordings.

The settlement resulted in a second-quarter net benefit to K-tel of $0.22 per share. This brought the total earnings per share in the first half to $0.68. Second-half earnings of $0.46 on top of the first half's $0.68 would bring the year to a total of $1.14.
In fiscal 1996, K-tel recorded a loss of $0.20 per share.
